The first season will have 10 episodes and if it does well we will be making the second season." <br><br>The show is reportedly titled "Made in Heaven".<br><br>Apart from them, directors like Vikas Bahl, Vikramaditya Motwane, Farhan Akhtar, Ram Madhvani, D K Krishna and Raj Nidimoru, Sujoy Ghosh and Asif Kapadia will be making unique shows for the Amazon Prime Video.<br><br>Asked whether filmmakers are keen to concentrate more on making shows than films, Zoya said: "I don't think that. This is a different and long format. So for a filmmaker and writer who are used to tell the story in two hours, this is an opportunity for us to tell a story in a long format. <br><br>"At the end of the day it's filmmaking and writing. It's just a different format and that's why we are happy to experiment with it."<br><br>Reema said: "I love watching shows as much as I love watching films. There is an advantage for us in making long format shows." <br><br> -- IANS<br> iv/sas/bg</p>

item.title: Paltering viewed as harshly as intentional lying
item.description: New York, Dec 15 (IANS) Creating a mistaken impression by telling the truth is not only possible, it has a name - paltering. But the results of being found out can be just as harsh as intentional lying, warns a study.
item.content: New York, Dec 15 (IANS) Creating a mistaken impression by telling the truth is not only possible, it has a name - paltering. But the results of being found out can be just as harsh as intentional lying, warns a study.<p><br><br>"Rather than misstating facts or failing to provide information, paltering involves actively making truthful statements to create a mistaken impression," said lead study author Todd Rogers of Harvard University.<br><br>Paltering is used by politicians commonly, according to Rogers. <br><br>One famous example Rogers cited was when former US President Bill Clinton said "there is not a sexual relationship" between him and former White House intern Monica Lewinski. <br><br>The Starr commission later discovered that there had been a sexual relationship but it had ended months before Clinton made that statement -- thus, it was technically true but clearly misleading.<br><br>"To date, research has primarily focused on two types of deception: Lying by commission -- the active use of false statements -- and lying by omission -- the passive act of misleading by failing to disclose relevant information," Rogers said. <br><br>"In this study, we make a novel contribution to the deception literature by identifying a third, and common, form of deception," Rogers noted.<br><br>The researchers conducted two pilot studies and six experiments involving over 1,750 participants.<br><br>The first pilot study confirmed that people in general could distinguish paltering as a distinct form of deception, different from lying by commission or omission. <br><br>In the second pilot study, the researchers determined that it is a common form of deception, with over 50 per cent of business executives enrolled in an advanced negotiation course at Harvard Business School admitting they had paltered in some or most of their negotiations.<br><br>In the experiments, the researchers discovered that people preferred paltering to lying by commission, but the results of being found out can be just as harsh. <br><br>While palterers tended to think of their actions as more ethical because they essentially told the truth, when the deception was revealed, they were graded as harshly by their counterparts as if they had lied by commission, said the study published in the Journal of Personality and Social Psychology.<br><br>"When individuals discover that a prospective negotiation partner has paltered to them in the past, they are less likely to trust that partner and, therefore, less likely to negotiate with that person again," Rogers said.<br><br>--IANS<br>gb/dg</p>

item.title: Was excited to try short film format: Atul Kulkarni
item.description: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Critically acclaimed actor Atul Kulkarni, who features in one of the short films which are part of the anthology movie "Shor Se Shuruaat", says he was interested to explore the format which offers limited screen space and time.
item.content: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Critically acclaimed actor Atul Kulkarni, who features in one of the short films which are part of the anthology movie "Shor Se Shuruaat", says he was interested to explore the format which offers limited screen space and time.<p><br><br>Atul, who features in "Azad" -- one of the seven indie projects that make up HumaraMovie banner's "Shor Se Shuruaat", said in a statement: "I had never worked in a short format, so I was pretty excited to try this form of storytelling."<br><br>"As far as the subject of the film is concerned, it's extremely relevant. The movie deals with freedom of speech, and its inconveniences.<br><br>"As far as my role is concerned, in a short film, how and what you conceive is different from a feature film. You are supposed to convey the entire story in 20 to 25 minutes since there's only so much screen space and time. It doesn't have the luxury of many scenes and that kind of operation."<br><br>On his role as Azad, he said: "The character is pretty simple. I play a part time journalist, who speaks his mind. There's a parallel story line that depicts his estranged relationship with his son, so there are two very interesting tracks within the short."<br><br>All projects in the anthology are based on a common theme of 'shor' (noise). <br><br>Vinay Mishra, co-founder of HumaraMovie, said: "Shorts are a great way for big names to try something new and to experiment. Unfortunately, we don't see much of that from the big names. It would be great if they used their stature to push the envelope rather than use shorts to do more of the same.<br><br>"Their involvement, be it Sanjay Mishra, Atul Kulkarni, Sakshi Tanwar as actors, or Mira Nair, Shyam Benegal, Imtiaz Ali as mentors, or Gulzar sahab or Rekha Bhardwaj singing, has definitely given a much-needed impetus to a project like 'Shor Se Shuruaat. When big names like this are passionate about doing something new, then it gives a tremendous boost to the medium and the people around."<br><br>--IANS<br>rb/bg</p>

item.title: 'Phenomenal' Zlatan, Pogba impress Man United manager Mourinho
item.description: London, Dec 15 (IANS) Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho lauded stars Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Paul Pogba for their "phenomenal" performances in the team's 2-1 win over Crystal Palace in the English Premier League football.
item.content: London, Dec 15 (IANS) Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho lauded stars Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Paul Pogba for their "phenomenal" performances in the team's 2-1 win over Crystal Palace in the English Premier League football.<p><br><br>"I think they both were phenomenal during the game. The pass obviously is fantastic, the movement is great, the shot is good, but for me I probably prefer what Zlatan did after the goal because that was phenomenal," Mourinho told the club's official website after the match on Wednesday.<br><br>"He played in front of the back four, winning every ball in the air, controlling on the chest, cooling down the play, he is phenomenal. It is not just the goals that he scores, it is not just the goal that gives us three points, it is the leadership, the desire, the passion. Fantastic!" the Portuguese waxed eloquent about his two pre-season signings.<br><br>Defender Eric Bailly picked up a knock within the first seven minutes but continued to play for the first half. The second half was hard for the Ivorian as he had to be taken off soon after the restart with Matteo Darmian replacing him.<br><br>"We don't know (how serious it is). It is the left knee. Of course he has a problem with another dimension but showed amazing character to try and try, and try until his limit," Mourinho said.<br><br>United are sixth in the points table with 27 points after 16 matches, in a list headed by Chelsea (40).<br><br>On the title race and whether United were catching up, Mourinho said, "We are doing enough for that. If we had the points we lost at home in the draws in matches that we did more than enough to win then we would be close to the top of the league, but we lost these points and at this moment we are just closing the gap to the top four positions.<br><br>"There are three more matches before the end of the year and let's see how it looks on 31 December," Mourinho added.<br><br>--IANS<br>dm/sam/bg</p>

item.title: MobiKwik to help 30 lakh street vendors go digital
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Domestic mobile wallet platform MobiKwik and the National Association of Street Vendors of India (NASVI) on Thursday teamed up to empower over 30 lakh street vendors from 25 states to use digital transactions.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Domestic mobile wallet platform MobiKwik and the National Association of Street Vendors of India (NASVI) on Thursday teamed up to empower over 30 lakh street vendors from 25 states to use digital transactions.<p><br><br>"We will train 10 lakh street vendors in three months to enable them to transact digitally. MobiKwik payments will soon be accepted by 30 lakh street vendors in 25 states directly," said Upasana Taku, Co-founder of MobiKwik, in a statement.<br><br>MobiKwik recently launched MobiKwik Lite which allows smaller and unorganised retailers and shopkeepers accept payments seamlessly. <br><br>"Due to demonetisation, street vendors all across India lost 70 per cent of their business and it affected them badly. Thus, NASVI has come up with Mobikwik to provide the solution and make them aware about cashless economy," said Arbind Singh, Founder, NASVI.<br> <br>--IANS<br>qd/na/bg</p>

item.title: 50% citizens to benefit from smart city initiatives globally: Gartner
item.description: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Nearly 50 per cent of citizens in large cities globally will benefit from smart city programmes by sharing personal data by 2019, market research firm Gartner said on Thursday.
item.content: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Nearly 50 per cent of citizens in large cities globally will benefit from smart city programmes by sharing personal data by 2019, market research firm Gartner said on Thursday.<p><br><br>The volume and diversity of the data generated by citizens will continue to grow in line with the proliferation of consumer devices and the internet of things (IoT), it added.<br><br>"As citizens increasingly use personal technology and social networks to organise their lives, governments and businesses are growing their investments in technology infrastructure and governance," said Anthony Mullen, Research Director, Gartner, in a statement. <br><br>Citizens as well as governments are turning to conversational platforms like virtual personal assistants and messaging bots over traditional apps and websites.<br><br>"Volume of machine-readable data generated on how citizens interact with government and their city is rapidly growing, creating a huge opportunity to develop open data portals that can increase efficiency, improve citizen experience, drive innovation and generate revenue for government organisations," the report added.<br><br>Gartner predicts that 20 per cent of all local government organisations will generate revenue from value-added open data through data market places by 2020. <br><br>--IANS<br>anuj/na/bg</p>

item.title: Akshay offers fans chance to 'book seats for 'Jolly LLB 2' trailer launch
item.description: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) In a new marketing innovation, Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar and Fox Star Studios have given an opportunity to audiences and fans to book seats for the trailer launch of "Jolly LLB 2". The event is scheduled for December 19.
item.content: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) In a new marketing innovation, Bollywood actor Akshay Kumar and Fox Star Studios have given an opportunity to audiences and fans to book seats for the trailer launch of "Jolly LLB 2". The event is scheduled for December 19.<p><br><br>The social media driven innovation is open to audiences worldwide. As many as 100,000 people will get to witness the trailer half an hour before its official release. This is for the first time that so many people will get access to the film's asset even before it's officially launched, read a statement from the film's makers.<br><br>Set in Lucknow, "Jolly LLB 2" is the story of the blunt, abrasive and yet oddly compassionate Jagdishwar Mishra aka Jolly, a small-time, struggling lawyer who has moved from Kanpur to the city of nawabs to pursue his dream of becoming a big-time lawyer. <br><br>The movie is a satire about an underdog attempting to catapult himself to the top of the legal food chain.<br><br>Presented and produced by Fox Star Studios and directed by Subhash Kapoor, the film will release on February 10, 2017.<br><br>--IANS<br>rb/bg</p>

item.title: YouTuber, glam-ma make it into OED with Brexit
item.description: London, Dec 15 (IANS) The world may still be divided over Brexit in terms of its implementation and consequences, but the Oxford English Dictionary (OED) has given it an official nod with 1,500 other new words.
item.content: London, Dec 15 (IANS) The world may still be divided over Brexit in terms of its implementation and consequences, but the Oxford English Dictionary (OED) has given it an official nod with 1,500 other new words.<p><br><br>OED editors steered clear of political controversy by defining the process of Brexit rather than its consequences or implementation, as they added the word to the dictionary this week, the Guardian reported.<br><br>The definition reads: "The (proposed) withdrawal of the United Kingdom from the European Union, and the political process associated with it. Sometimes used specifically with reference to the referendum held in the UK on 23 June 2016, in which a majority of voters favoured withdrawal from the EU."<br><br>Fiona McPherson, senior editor on the OED, told the Guardian that the word has been "one of the fastest" to move from coinage to definition and listing. <br><br>The influence of social media is clearly visible in many of the new coinages this time. "YouTuber", defined as "frequent user of the video-sharing website YouTube, especially someone who produces and appears in videos on the site" has found a place in the OED for the first time. <br><br>Those who stand up to internet trolls can now call themselves an "upstander", defined as "a person who speaks or acts in support of a cause, especially one who intervenes on behalf a person being attacked or bullied".<br><br>Though many additions to the 829,000 words in the dictionary arise from young people and social media, some also reflect the ageing population. Leading the way for Baby Boomers is "glam-ma: a glamorous grandmother, especially one who is comparatively young or fashion-conscious."<br><br>--IANS<br>ss/sm/vt</p>

item.title: Messi to marry long time girlfriend: Reports
item.description: Barcelona, Dec 15 (IANS) Football superstar Lionel Messi and long time girlfriend Antonella Roccuzzo have decided to get married, according to Spanish media reports.
item.content: Barcelona, Dec 15 (IANS) Football superstar Lionel Messi and long time girlfriend Antonella Roccuzzo have decided to get married, according to Spanish media reports.<p><br><br>The couple will take the leap at a time convenient to Messi's footballing career, which can either be the summer or winter of 2017, according to Spanish daily Marca on Wednesday.<br><br>The report adds that they have been mulling over the idea for some time.<br><br>The star wedding will most likely be in his native Argentina, where he met Roccuzzo when they were both youngsters.<br><br>The nature of the couple's relationship was made public in 2007, with the model moving to Barcelona in 2010. They have two children, Thiago, four, and Mateo, one.<br><br>A raft of his FC Barcelona clubmates and staff are expected to attend the special day when it happens.<br><br>--IANS<br>dm/sam/bg</p>

item.title: Cisco to help develop IoT innovation hub, smart city in Gujarat
item.description: Gandhinagar, Dec 15 (IANS) To help accelerate the digital transformation of Gujarat, global networking giant Cisco on Thursday announced to explore setting up an Internet of Things (IoT) Innovation Hub and deliver a smart city in the state.
item.content: Gandhinagar, Dec 15 (IANS) To help accelerate the digital transformation of Gujarat, global networking giant Cisco on Thursday announced to explore setting up an Internet of Things (IoT) Innovation Hub and deliver a smart city in the state.<p><br><br>Cisco signed two Memorandums of Understanding (MoUs) with the state government which aim to establish an IoT Innovation hub with the International Centre for Entrepreneurship and Technology (iCreate) at iCreate's campus near Bavla, Ahmedabad, and deliver a smart city project in Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT).<br><br>"The announcement underlines Cisco's commitment to enable Gujarat to capitalise on digital opportunities, strengthen the vibrant innovation ecosystem in the state, enhance quality of life of citizens and accelerate the digital transformation of the state," said Dinesh Malkani, President, Cisco India and Saarc, at the event.<br><br>The MoUs were signed in the presence of Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani, Deputy Chief Minister of Gujarat Nitin Bhai Patel and Dinesh Malkani, President, Cisco India and Saarc, among others.<br><br>"My vision is to digitally empower every citizen, enhance the quality of life, enable ease of doing business and become an innovation and knowledge hub for the country. We are happy to have Cisco partner with us to help build Gujarat's economy of the future," Rupani said.<br><br>The IoT Innovation Hub at iCreate's campus will enable startups and entrepreneurs build smart city and IoT-based solutions. <br><br>"We are excited to partner with Cisco for the IoT innovation hub, which will be a tremendous accelerator for startups to develop digital solutions that reach global markets," added Anupam Jalote, CEO, iCreate.<br><br>GIFT City, being developed as India's first greenfield smart city, has many unique features like District Cooling solution - a first-of-its-kind utility tunnel and ready availability of a next-gen data centre.<br><br>Cisco and GIFT are exploring deployment of smart city applications including public Wi-Fi, smart parking, smart transport, traffic analytics, Remote Expert Government Services (REGS), smart kiosk, smart environmental sensors along with the City Digital Platform (CDP).<br><br>"GIFT is using ICT as a strategic differentiator - putting technology at the foundation of its expansive community. As India's first operational smart city, GIFT has helped transform how cities are built, managed and experienced," noted Ajay Pandey, MD and Group CEO of GIFT.<br><br>--IANS<br>na/bg</p>

item.title: Yogeshwar criticises compensation to Wani family
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Star wrestler Yogeshwar Dutt has lashed out at the Jammu and Kashmir government for its decision to give compensation to slain terrorist Burhan Wani's family for the death of his brother Khalid in a shootout.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Star wrestler Yogeshwar Dutt has lashed out at the Jammu and Kashmir government for its decision to give compensation to slain terrorist Burhan Wani's family for the death of his brother Khalid in a shootout.<p><br><br>Khalid was allegedly killed by the security forces while attempting to visit his brother in the forests of Tral area of the Kashmir Valley on April 13, 2012.<br><br>The PDP-BJP coalition government in Jammu and Kashmir has announced a compensation of Rs.4 lakh to Khalid's family. Khalid is one of 106 people killed either by security forces or terrorists whose families will be paid compensation by the state government.<br><br>"The morale of the Army and people is affected by such news. It is a matter of great regret that on the one hand Army personnel are sacrificing their lives for the country while on the other hand terrorists are getting compensation," Yogeshwar tweeted in Hindi on Thursday.<br><br>The London Olympics bronze medallist has a strong opinion on various national issues and has used social media to vent his feeling on several earlier occasions.<br><br>Burhan, a popular terrorist leader in the Kashmir Valley belonging to the Pakistan-backed Hizbul Mujahideen terror outfit, was gunned down earlier this year by the security forces. His killing sparked large-scale protests, leading to the deaths of nearl a hundred persons.<br><br>--IANS<br>ajb/vt</p>

item.title: TMC protests in front of RBI during Governor's visit
item.description: Kolkata, Dec 15 (IANS) The Trinamool Congress ministers and state legislators on Thursday held a sit-in for the second consecutive day in front of the Reserve Bank of India's regional office in Kolkata, protesting insufficient supply of new currency notes in the state, while RBI Governor Urjit Patel was attending the apex bank's board meeting inside the building.
item.content: Kolkata, Dec 15 (IANS) The Trinamool Congress ministers and state legislators on Thursday held a sit-in for the second consecutive day in front of the Reserve Bank of India's regional office in Kolkata, protesting insufficient supply of new currency notes in the state, while RBI Governor Urjit Patel was attending the apex bank's board meeting inside the building.<p><br><br>Several Trinamool supporters alongwith the party heavyweights shouted slogans and waved black flags at the gate of the Reserve Bank, demanding a roll back of the central government's demonetisation of high-value currency notes that has created an unprecedented cash crisis in the nation.<br><br>"The Prime Minister should explain why the demonetisation was done. If it was for the benefit of common man, then why so many people are still queuing up in front of RBI office even after 37 days of the decision," questioned state Irrigation Minister Rajib Banerjee.<br><br>"It's strange that what the (RBI) Governor should decide, is being decided by the Prime Minister. Total seven countries tried the demonetisation drive in history and all have failed miserably. What made them think it would be successful in a vast country like India," he asked.<br><br>"The RBI Governor owes an explanation to the common people for snatching away their democratic rights. We demand an immediate roll-back of this decision," party spokesperson Nirmal Ghosh said, referring to Patel's visit to the city.<br><br>--IANS<br>bdc-mgr/ssp/ahm/vt</p>

item.title: DSK Shivajians sign five Indians for I-League
item.description: Pune, Dec 15 (IANS) For its I-League football side, DSK Shivajians FC on Thursday completed the signings of five home-grown footballers from Indian Super League (ISL) outfit NorthEast United FC.
item.content: Pune, Dec 15 (IANS) For its I-League football side, DSK Shivajians FC on Thursday completed the signings of five home-grown footballers from Indian Super League (ISL) outfit NorthEast United FC.<p><br><br>Subrata Paul, Halicharan Narzary, Nirmal Chettri, Lallianzuala Chhangte and Jerry Mawihmingthanga all returned to the club from the Guwahati-based ISL franchise, according to a club release.<br><br>The I-League starts on January 7.<br><br>Forward Narzary, 22, has made seven senior national team appearances so far in his budding career.<br><br>The 26-year-old Chettri, a seasoned professional is a versatile defender and is part of the Indian team set-up since 2011.<br><br>The biggest signing was Paul's, who re-joins the club after playing for them last season. The veteran goalkeeper, an India regular with 64 caps, is a big name among the home-based players. <br><br>DSK coach Dave Rogers expressed happiness to sign the footballers.<br><br>He said, "I have followed Halicharan's progress over the last two years. His development in the Indian national team, and his performances at the top level have been excellent. He is one of India's brightest young talents and his pace and quality from wide areas adds another dimension to our game and a threat to opposition teams."<br><br>"Nirmal is a model professional with excellent experience; and a desire and passion which he carries both on and off the pitch. He will lead by example and bring organization along with commitment and dedication which is one of the main recruitment strategies we have at this club," <br><br>"Subrata Paul for me is the best goalkeeper in India; so to sign him for DSK Shivajians is a real coup for our club," he added.<br><br>--IANS<br>sam/vt</p>

item.title: Kerala HC fixes January 4 for hearing in Lavalin case
item.description: Kochi, Dec 15 (IANS) The Kerala High Court on Thursday fixed January 4 for hearing on a CBI revision petition in the SNC Lavalin case.
item.content: Kochi, Dec 15 (IANS) The Kerala High Court on Thursday fixed January 4 for hearing on a CBI revision petition in the SNC Lavalin case.<p><br><br>Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan was an accused in the case filed by the Central Bureau of Investigation, but a special court here exonerated him in 2013.<br><br>The CBI then approached the High Court against the exoneration.<br><br>Hearing the petition on Thursday, the court said it was ready to hear all parties from January 4 and hold continuous sittings thereafter till January 12. <br><br>Additional Solicitor General of India K.N. Natarajan, who appeared for the CBI, said he needed three days to present his arguments.<br><br>The case pertains to an agreement with Canadian company SNC Lavalin in 1997, when Vijayan was the state Power Minister, to repair three generators, which allegedly caused a loss of Rs 266 crore to the exchequer.<br><br>Vijayan was arraigned by the CBI as the seventh accused in the case, leading to a political furore.<br><br>The Communist Party of India-Marxist leadership, however, came to his defence and said there was no reason for him to step down as secretary of the CPI(M) Kerala State Committee as it is not a constitutional post.<br><br>--IANS<br>sg/tsb/bg</p>

item.title: Rajya Sabha adjourned for the day
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) The Rajya Sabha was on Thursday adjourned for the day amid sloganeering and counter-sloganeering by the opposition and treasury benches on demonetisation, plight of farmers and AgustaWestland chopper deal.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) The Rajya Sabha was on Thursday adjourned for the day amid sloganeering and counter-sloganeering by the opposition and treasury benches on demonetisation, plight of farmers and AgustaWestland chopper deal.<p><br><br>As soon as the house met at 2 p.m. after three earlier adjournments, opposition members trooped near the Chairman's podium while members from the treasury benches started shouting slogans over the AgustaWestland case.<br><br>Amid the din, the house was adjourned for the day.<br><br>--IANS<br>bns/tsb/vt</p>

item.title: CEC cautions Goa against casinos' misuse for poll funding
item.description: Panaji, Dec 15 (IANS) Chief Election Commissioner Nasim Zaidi said on Thursday that the Goa Chief Secretary has been asked to ensure that black money is not stashed with the casinos of the state by political parties and funds are not diverted.
item.content: Panaji, Dec 15 (IANS) Chief Election Commissioner Nasim Zaidi said on Thursday that the Goa Chief Secretary has been asked to ensure that black money is not stashed with the casinos of the state by political parties and funds are not diverted.<p><br><br>There is a "serious concern" about the issue, and the Chief Secretary ahs been asked to keep tabs on the casinos in the state, Zaidi said. <br><br>"We conducted a meeting with the state Chief Secretary and the Home Secretary. We have asked them to ensure that casinos are not misused. They should keep tabs on casinos," Zaidi said.<br><br>When asked if there was a need to ban the casinos for the duration of the Model Code of Conduct as and when it is announced, Zaidi said: "We do not need to interfere in their normal day-to-day activities since this is a tourism-oriented place."<br><br>"But we will keep track on activities related to diversion of funds and we have told the Chief Secretary that his machinery should keep tabs on them," Zaidi added.<br><br>The country's top election official, who chaired a review of the poll preparation in Goa, which is likely to go to polls early next year, also said that political parties in the state had red-flagged that casinos could be misused by vested interests for parking and diversion of money.<br><br>"They have given us written representations. We have also had a briefing with the Chief Secretary and we have conveyed our concerns, serious concerns, about the likely misuse of casinos and likely undue haste in finalising schemes without figuring the statutory provisions," Zaidi said.<br><br>"The Chief Secretary has taken note of it and he has assured us that he would look into these representations and will go according to law and procedures," he added.<br><br>Goa has five operational offshore casinos parked in the Mandovi river off Panaji, and nine onshore casinos housed in the numerous five-star resorts in the state's coastal regions.<br><br>--IANS<br>maya/vgu/vt</p>

item.title: Senator hits out at Trump's Secretary pick over Russia ties
item.description: Washington, Dec 15 (IANS) A senior Republican Senator has said he would not support any Cabinet nominees of President-elect Donald Trump who oppose sanctions against Russia.
item.content: Washington, Dec 15 (IANS) A senior Republican Senator has said he would not support any Cabinet nominees of President-elect Donald Trump who oppose sanctions against Russia.<p><br><br>His remarks were aimed at US State Secretary-nominee Rex Tillerson, who is CEO of oil giant Exxon Mobil, and is known to have close ties with Russian President Vladimir Putin.<br><br>"I can't imagine I would vote for anybody that believes that we should not sanction Russia given the fact that they did interfere in our election," Xinhua news agency quoted Lindsey Graham as saying in an interview on CNN.<br><br>"If somebody wants to be Secretary of State, and they hear briefings that I heard, and they don't believe the Russians were involved in our election, interfering in our elections, then I really question their judgement," he said.<br><br>The New York Times also reported that hacker groups linked to the Russian government have been actively trying to obtain information from the Democratic National Committee since 2015.<br><br>US President Barack Obama has ordered a probe into alleged election-related hackings done by Russia.<br><br>--IANS<br>soni/ahm/dg</p>

item.title: Dilip Kumar discharged from hospital
item.description: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Veteran actor Dilip Kumar, who was admitted at Lilavati Hospital and Research Centre last week, was on Thursday discharged from the facility.
item.content: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Veteran actor Dilip Kumar, who was admitted at Lilavati Hospital and Research Centre last week, was on Thursday discharged from the facility.<p><br><br>"Dilip Kumar got discharged today around 2.30 p.m. He is fine now," Murshid, the manager of Dilip Kumar's wife Saira Banu, told IANS.<br><br>Dilip Kumar, who turned 94 on December 11, was rushed to the hospital after he complained of swelling on one of his legs.<br><br>Last seen on the big screen in "Qila" in 1998, the actor was awarded the Dadasaheb Phalke Award in 1994 and the Padma Vibhushan in 2015.<br><br>--IANS<br>uma/rb/vt</p>

item.title: Vadra concerned over demonetisation
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Congress President Sonia Gandhi's son-in-law Robert Vadra on Thursday expressed concerns for people suffering due to demonetisation.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Congress President Sonia Gandhi's son-in-law Robert Vadra on Thursday expressed concerns for people suffering due to demonetisation.<p><br><br>"Never ending queues outside banks and ATMs, with people battling the cold and waiting (for) days to withdraw their hard earned money. It's been more than a month??" Vadra posted on Facebook.<br><br>"A girl commits suicide because she couldn't withdraw the money to pay her college fees, a man dies in the queue and no one comes forward to help... so many other heart wrenching stories..."<br><br>Vadra said: "First we were told it was to clean up black money, then terrorism, now we're told it's to make ours a cashless society...<br><br>"Whichever it is, did so many people have to suffer so much, lose their livelihood and even their lives to satisfy the imaginary objectives of one man's ego?"<br><br>--IANS<br>sid/in/mr</p>

item.title: Artist hails spirit of collaboration in Indian art scene
item.description: Kolkata, Dec 15 (IANS) Internationally acclaimed French-Bengali artist Chittrovanu Mazumdar who faced "challenges" trying to complete his art work on time due to demonetisation has hailed the generosity and collaborative aspect of the art scene in India.
item.content: Kolkata, Dec 15 (IANS) Internationally acclaimed French-Bengali artist Chittrovanu Mazumdar who faced "challenges" trying to complete his art work on time due to demonetisation has hailed the generosity and collaborative aspect of the art scene in India.<p><br><br>Mazumdar, who has his creation displayed at the third edition of 'Kochi-Muziris Biennale', expressed his gratitude for the help he received to finish his art work in the midst of the note ban.<br><br>"The first few days of demonetisation were really hard across the country and everyone struggled to adjust. With regards to building this installation for Kochi, we faced some challenges trying to complete the piece on time," Mazumdar said.<br><br>"The workers stopped coming as they were not willing to accept cheques, the cash-flow was completely choked and it was impossible to get to a bank," he said. <br><br>"However, thanks to the great support from friends and patrons we were able to borrow the cash as we needed larger volumes than was permitted to withdraw from the banks or ATMs," Mazumdar told IANS from Kochi. <br><br>He was grateful for the amazing support as the "installation was completed and packed in time to be transported to Kochi".<br><br>Mazumdar, who considers himself an "expressionist painter", said his installation would depict the elemental force of water as it appears in the human psyche and the surrounding environment.<br><br>The silver lining, according to Mazumdar, was the "generosity and collaborative nature of the art scene in India, as we see people come together despite the challenges".<br><br>--IANS<br>sgh/in/bg</p>

item.title: Treasury members disrupting Lok Sabha unprecedented: Scindia
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Congress's Lok Sabha member Jyotiraditya Scindia on Thursday said it was "unprecedented" that the treasury benches disrupting the proceedings of the house.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Congress's Lok Sabha member Jyotiraditya Scindia on Thursday said it was "unprecedented" that the treasury benches disrupting the proceedings of the house.<p><br><br>"We are seeing for the first time in (Parliament's) history that treasury members are trying to disrupt the house. And their senior ministers are provoking them. They are displaying posters in the house," Scindia said.<br><br>"They have been trying their best to disrupt the house for the last one week. Why are they doing this," the Lok Sabha member asked.<br><br>He said it was clear that the government was running away from discussion.<br><br>"They are scared and want to run away from discussion. They have lost their face. But the entire opposition will unmask them," he said.<br><br>Both the government and the opposition have been accusing each other of disrupting Parliament and running away from discussions.<br><br>--IANS<br>mak/ahm/vt</p>

item.title: India lose to Uruguay in U-17 football meet
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) The India U-17 football team went down to Uruguay 1-2 in their last match of the round-robin stage match in the Atletico Paranaense U-17 International Tournament.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) The India U-17 football team went down to Uruguay 1-2 in their last match of the round-robin stage match in the Atletico Paranaense U-17 International Tournament.<p><br><br>Wednesday's defeat was India's third straight defeat in the tournament, according to an All-India Football Federation (AIFF) release here.<br><br>After conceding two goals on either side of the break, Komal Thatal halved the difference but a gritty Uruguayan defence contained the Indian attackers till the final whistle.<br><br>India coach Nicolai Adam made one change in the starting eleven from Tuesday's match against Atletico Paranaense, handing Lalengmawia his first start in the tournament over Aman Chetri.<br><br>India are slated to face Uruguay again on Friday.<br><br>--IANS<br>dm/sam/dg</p>

item.title: Prince Narula recovering after tonsillitis
item.description: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Actor Prince Narula, who was hospitalised following aggravated tonsil trouble, is now recovering at his home.
item.content: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Actor Prince Narula, who was hospitalised following aggravated tonsil trouble, is now recovering at his home.<p><br><br>Prince, who is currently seen as Lucky in popular TV show "Badho Bahu", fell ill while he was travelling for promotional activities.<br><br>"Work is priority and I can't ignore it no matter what. Recently, I was a bit unwell and my travel added up to it so bad that I have got tonsils and can barely speak," Prince said in a statement.<br><br>"The cast and crew of �Badho Bahu' have been so cooperative and understanding about my health that they have given me a break for my speedy recovery. I hope I get well soon," he added.<br><br>--IANS<br>sas/rb/mr</p>

item.title: 300 liquor outlets in Kerala to down shutters
item.description: Thiruvananthapuram, Dec 15 (IANS) Around 300 liquor outlets in Kerala will down shutters from the new fiscal in line with the Supreme Court's ruling banning the sale of liquor along highways.
item.content: Thiruvananthapuram, Dec 15 (IANS) Around 300 liquor outlets in Kerala will down shutters from the new fiscal in line with the Supreme Court's ruling banning the sale of liquor along highways.<p><br><br>A bench, headed by Supreme Court Chief Justice T.S. Thakur, on Thursday said all vendors holding licences for selling liquor would continue to do so till their licences were valid or till March 31, 2017, whichever was earlier, following which the licences would not be renewed.<br><br>The order came on a batch of petitions including those by the states and NGOs. The apex court's ruling bans liquor sale within 500 metres on either side of national and state highways across the country<br><br>Kerala Excise Minister T.P. Ramakrishnan told reporters here that he is yet to get a copy of the ruling and the decision would be adhered to by the state government.<br><br>"Once we get a copy of the judgement, we will study it ... at the moment, there is no decision as yet, whether to go in for appeal. First, let us get the judgement," said Ramakrishnan.<br><br>In Kerala, liquor is presently served in around 30 five-star hotels and around 600 beer and wine parlours besides 334 state-owned retail outlets.<br><br>For the beer and wine parlour owners, this new decision could spell the end of their business as it cannot be moved from the present location but the state-owned retail outlets could possibly move away from the highways.<br><br>"It's not an easy task as the new retail outlets will have to ensure that other restrictions do not affect their opening at a new location, as laws are stringent. Besides the laws, there could be possible agitations by the local populace," said an industry source.<br><br>Biju Ramesh, who owns beer parlours in Thiruvananthapuram, said he welcomes the decision even though he would have to close down a few of his parlours.<br><br>Since 2015, following the liquor policy of the then Oommen Chandy government, more than 700 bars in two-, three- and four-star hotels were closed down, after which many of them began functioning as wine and beer parlours. <br><br>--IANS<br>sg/pgh/dg</p>

item.title: Can't grow beard on religious ground in armed forces: SC
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) The Supreme Court on Thursday rejected a plea by two IAF personnel seeking to grow beard, saying IAF's policies on personal appearance were not intended to discriminate against religious beliefs.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) The Supreme Court on Thursday rejected a plea by two IAF personnel seeking to grow beard, saying IAF's policies on personal appearance were not intended to discriminate against religious beliefs.<p><br><br>Rejecting the plea by Mohamed Zubair and Ansari Aaftab Ahmed, Chief Justice T.S. Thakur, Justice D.Y. Chandrachud and Justice L. Nageswara Rao said: "Regulation and policies in regard to personal appearances are not intended to discriminate against religious beliefs nor do they have the affect of doing so.<br><br>"Their (regulation and policies) object and purpose is to ensure uniformity, cohesiveness, discipline and order which are indispensable to the air force as indeed to every armed force," the ruling said. <br><br>Zubair had challenged the rejection by the Indian Air Force (IAF) of his request for growing beard on religious ground as he was a Muslim.<br><br>Zubair had applied for permission to sport a beard on January 10, 2005 and the same was rejected by the Commanding Officer the next month. <br><br>--IANS<br>pk/mr/sar</p>

item.title: Demonetisation: Cashlessness sting still painful
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) There was no respite in sight for cash-strapped people on Thursday as queues outside banks and ATMs for money withdrawal continued across the city with rising anger and pain.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) There was no respite in sight for cash-strapped people on Thursday as queues outside banks and ATMs for money withdrawal continued across the city with rising anger and pain.<p><br><br>An IANS correspondent who visited about 10 banks and ATMs in east Delhi found over 150 people outside Punjab National Bank and State Bank of India in Radheypuri area of east Delhi. Similar conditions were witnessed outside the Indian Overseas Bank, ICICI Bank and Axis Bank in Preet Vihar area.<br><br>Bobby Arora, a resident of Radheypuri told IANS: "I have my account in this branch of Punjab National Bank, but everyday the bank is running out of cash within two hours after opening in the morning."<br><br>Many among the crowd argued with the security guard positioned outside the branch for not informing them that the bank had run out of cash. <br><br>Out of desperation, many customers asked the guard to let them in to see for themselves that there was no cash.<br><br>Many customers complained that they were never informed if there was any cash left or not.<br><br>Pradeep Bhanot, who runs a tiles shop in Jagatpuri area of east Delhi, said that he too was unable to make a single transaction from the bank or ATM kiosk in the last 10 days. <br><br>"It's 15 December now, and I need to pay my workers here," he said, adding, "Each and everyone of my staff don't have bank accounts. So I am facing a problem." <br><br>Lashing out at the government, he said: "Most of the staff at my shop are illiterate and expecting e-banking from them is a cruel joke."<br><br>Serpentine queues have been witnessed across the country after the government's November 8 decision to spike higher currency notes to curb "black money and corruption". <br><br>Hundreds of people were also seen waiting outside ATMs in south Delhi's Kalkaji area early Thursday morning to get some cash from the HDFC and State Bank of Patiala branches, which were dispensing cash.<br><br>Expressing anger over the government's demonetisation move, Rahul Sharma, who runs a bike repairing shop in Govindpuri, termed the move a "cruel joke".<br><br>--IANS<br>aks/bns/ahm/bg</p>

item.title: Tata Motors' Union extends support to Ratan Tata
item.description: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Tata Motors Employees Union has come out in support of Tata Sons' interim Chairman Ratan Tata and stated that they have lost faith in the leadership of ousted Chairman Cyrus Mistry.
item.content: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Tata Motors Employees Union has come out in support of Tata Sons' interim Chairman Ratan Tata and stated that they have lost faith in the leadership of ousted Chairman Cyrus Mistry.<p><br><br>The 7,250-member-strong Union rubbished allegations made by Mistry in his letter to the shareholders of the group firms that a 'key reform measure' was undermined to get the trade unions' support.<br><br>The Union, in a letter issued on Wednesday, stated that the loss of confidence in Mistry resulted from its members remaining unconvinced of the �Measure for Performance' initiative even after 16 meetings were held on the issue.<br><br>"Keeping in mind the fact that in spite of verbal assurance given by our seniors in the management that an amicable settlement would be arrived at within a fortnight and since over 15 months have passed with no concrete action taken, the Union has now lost faith in Mistry's leadership which is often deliberately misleading," the letter from Tata Motors' Union stated.<br><br>Emphasising the need for workmen and management to be two sides of a well-balanced equation in any company, the letter by the Union expressed shock that a person of Mistry's stature would resort to such 'immature actions'.<br><br>"The management and the workmen are not two opposites, but rather two sides of a well-balanced equation," the letter elaborated. <br><br>"Henceforth, the Tata Motors Employees' Union and all its workmen will support Ratan Tata."<br><br>The Tata Motors Union also denounced inferences in Mistry's earlier communication that their office bearers' calling on Tata would in turn impact the ongoing discussions between the management of Tata Motors and the Tata Motors Employees' Union on the "Productivity-Linked Wage Settlement".<br><br>The Union, in its letter, termed the allegation as a 'lie' and said the meeting with Tata on November 10, 2016 was planned well in advance and not one to negotiate a deal.<br><br>At the meeting, Tata had appealed to all the workers of Tata Motors to work hard for the benefit of the company.<br><br>The Union explained that it did not discuss any issue or topic related to long-term wage settlement.<br> <br>The letter also specifically placed focus on the 'Settlements' of 2003, 2006 and 2009 under the leadership of Tata, where the Union had accepted quality, productivity, safety and profit-linked wage agreement linked to the prosperity of the company, which showed continuous improvements till 2012.<br><br>The Union's letter comes a day after Tata Teleservices (Maharashtra) removed Tata Sons' ousted Chairman Mistry from its board of Directors.<br><br>On Tuesday, more than 93 per cent shareholders of TCS had voted to remove Mistry as Director of the company in its extra-ordinary general meeting (EGM).<br><br>Earlier, Tata Industries removed Mistry from its board of directors. The company had taken the decision at its EGM held on Monday.<br><br>Several other Tata Group companies, including Tata Motors, have called EGMs to decide whether or not to remove Mistry from their respective boards.<br><br>On December 13, Tata Sons had hiked its stake in Tata Motors as it bought five crore additional shares at Rs 486.13 per share.<br><br>At the end of the last quarter on September 30, Tata Sons held 26.98 per cent stake in the company, while the complete promoter group had a holding of 33.01 per cent in Tata Motors. <br><br>The consolidation in Tata Sons' stake in its automobile subsidiary comes after Tata Motors called an EGM on December 22 to decide whether or not to remove Tata Sons' ousted Chairman Mistry as a Director from its board. <br><br>Tata Sons had earlier asked Mistry to follow his own assertions on corporate governance and step down from the boards of Tata companies.<br><br>Tata Sons' board ousted Mistry on October 24 and appointed Ratan Tata as the interim Chairman. <br><br>--IANS<br>ppg-rv/dg</p>

item.title: Delhi Poetry Festival to begin from Friday
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) The fourth season of Delhi Poetry Festival (DPF), organised by Poets Corner, is all set to begin here from December 16.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) The fourth season of Delhi Poetry Festival (DPF), organised by Poets Corner, is all set to begin here from December 16.<p><br><br>Held at the NCUI Auditorium and Convention Centre here, the event will be attended by many illustrious and eminent speakers, including William Dalrymple, Annu Kapoor, Sanjna Kapoor, Vidya Shah, Waseem Barelvi, Manglesh Dabral, Anamika, Vinita Nangia, Malini Awasthi, Jeet Thayil, Kuldip Singh, Atul Tiwari, Arundhathi Subramaniam, Keki Daruwalla, Sukrita Paul Kumar, Danish Iqbal, Hirawal Group, Madan Gopal Singh, Harpreet Singh and Joy Sengupta.<br><br>There are going to be interactive sessions with the speakers and panel discussions like 'Main Na Sone Di' where role of poetry and art in challenging the stereotypical mind-sets will be discussed while �Poetry on Love and Relationships' will explore different shades of love through verses.<br><br>Apart from these, there is also going to be Mushaira, a play on the famous poet Nazeer Akbarabadi -- performed by Atul Tiwari and Kuldeep Singh -- and a satirical play titled Muktibodh Ki Aulaad -- presented by a youth theatre group. Folk singer Malini Awasthi, popular for her rendition of wedding songs, will be singing some of her most popular 'vivah geets'. <br><br>"It is our effort to bring new forms around poetry every year at DPF. This year, there are more poetry based performances to draw people to poetry. Delhi Poetry Festival promises to become the landmark festival of Delhi," Dolly Singh, founder of Delhi Poetry Festival, said in a statement.<br><br>--IANS<br>som/sm/dg</p>

item.title: UK scholar, Fadnavis to get SIES-Kanchi Seer award
item.description: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and UK-based scholar in Sanskrit, Tamil and Telugu John Ralston Marr have been named for this year's SIES-Sri Chandrashekarendra Saraswati National Eminence Award, an official said on Thursday.
item.content: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis and UK-based scholar in Sanskrit, Tamil and Telugu John Ralston Marr have been named for this year's SIES-Sri Chandrashekarendra Saraswati National Eminence Award, an official said on Thursday.<p><br><br>While Fadnavis shall be honoured with the award in Public Leadership, Marr will get the award in the international category at a ceremony here on December 18.<br><br>Marr is a scholar in Sanskrit, Tamil and Telugu, besides being a Carnatic music teacher for 30 years in Britain.<br><br>Other awardees include ISRO Chairman A.S. Kiran Kumar for science and technology and Hari-Katha exponent Kamala Murthy.<br><br>Instituted by the South Indian Education Society (SIES) in 1998 in memory of the late Sri Chandrashekarendra Saraswati, who passed away in 1994 aged 100, each award carries a cash prize of Rs 250,000, a citation, a shawl and an ornamental lamp.<br><br>Some of the earlier recipients of the award include the late President A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, the late President Shankar Dayal Sharma, the late M.S. Subbulakshmi, the late Nani Palkhivala, the late Verghese Kurien, Lata Mangeshkar, Dilip Kumar and Amitabh Bachchan.<br><br>--IANS<br>qn/vg/mr</p>

item.title: Help Bengal's tea garden workers: Mamata to Centre, RBI
item.description: Kolkata, Dec 15 (IANS) West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday yet again urged the Centre and RBI to "extend a helping hand to tea garden workers", who she alleged were "dying" in the aftermath of demonetisation.
item.content: Kolkata, Dec 15 (IANS) West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Thursday yet again urged the Centre and RBI to "extend a helping hand to tea garden workers", who she alleged were "dying" in the aftermath of demonetisation.<p><br><br>Her comments came on a day when RBI Governor Urjit Patel was in the city to attend the apex bank's central board meet.<br><br>On the occasion of the International Tea Day, Banerjee said in her tweet that the tea garden workers were hungry and dying due to demonetisation. <br><br>"RBI must immediately restore payments by our government through DMs (district magistrates)," Banerjee said.<br><br>She said as many as 97 people died following the November 8 decision.<br><br>The Trinamool Congress (TMC) supremo had on Wednesday demanded that the RBI restore and continue payments by the state government till March 2017.<br><br>TMC legislators and senior state ministers organised a sit-in in front of the Reserve Bank of India office in Kolkata on Wednesday to protest against the insufficient supply of new currency notes in the state.<br><br>Banerjee also accused the central government of discriminating between states with regard to disbursement of cash from the RBI.<br><br>--IANS<br>sgh/ssp/in/bg</p>

item.title: Jharkhand slashes housing loan interest rate for MLAs
item.description: Ranchi, Dec 15 (IANS) The ruling Bharatiya Janata Party in Jarkhand has shown generosity towards legislators by slashing interest rate on housing loan to a mere four per cent.
item.content: Ranchi, Dec 15 (IANS) The ruling Bharatiya Janata Party in Jarkhand has shown generosity towards legislators by slashing interest rate on housing loan to a mere four per cent.<p><br><br>This announcement came as the Reserve Bank of India kept the interest rate unchanged, which was expected after demonetisation of high value currency notes.<br><br>Serving and former legislator will be able to get up to Rs 40 lakh housing loan at rate of 4 per cent per annum, said a decision cleared by the cabinet on Wednesday. <br><br>Chief Minister Raghubar Das, however, was yet to come out with any relief measures for daily wage labourers, farmers and common people hit by the demonetisation decision and the resultant cash crunch across the country.<br><br>Das, after coming to power in December 2014, hiked the salary of legislators, Ministers, and others. <br><br>In May 2015, the monthly salary of Jharkhand legislator was increased to Rs 210,333 from Rs 116,833. <br><br>--IANS<br>ns/ahm/dg</p>

item.title: England seamer Anderson ruled out for fifth Test
item.description: Chennai, Dec 15 (IANS) England's ace seamer James Anderson has been ruled out of the fifth and final cricket Test against India starting on Friday due to stiffness, captain Alastair Cook said on Thursday.
item.content: Chennai, Dec 15 (IANS) England's ace seamer James Anderson has been ruled out of the fifth and final cricket Test against India starting on Friday due to stiffness, captain Alastair Cook said on Thursday.<p><br><br>Anderson has struggled in the series with only four wickets from two matches after coming back from an injury to his left shoulder.<br><br>However, England are pleased with the fitness of fellow pacer Stuart Broad, who has been struggling with a foot injury.<br><br>"Alastair Cook has confirmed @jimmy9 will miss out in Chennai due to stiffness but @StuartBroad8 is back in contention #INDvENG," England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) reported on Twitter.<br><br>"Cook: "Broady is fit & has a chance. He bowled at a local ground yesterday. It's great to have him back." #INDvENG," it added in another tweet.<br><br>Anderson, 34, is England's most experienced bowler, having 467 wickets from 122 Tests.<br><br>England have already lost the five-match Test series against hosts India, having lost three consecutive matches after the opening draw.<br><br>--IANS<br>pur/bg</p>

item.title: US professor gets life threats over anti-Trump comments
item.description: Los Angeles, Dec 15 (IANS) A California college professor who had voiced anti-Trump comments has been forced into hiding after receiving death threats.
item.content: Los Angeles, Dec 15 (IANS) A California college professor who had voiced anti-Trump comments has been forced into hiding after receiving death threats.<p><br><br>Olga Perez Stable Cox, who teaches human sexuality at the Orange Coast College (OCC) in Costa Mesa, fled the state after a video of her rant was on Monday posted on Facebook, where it drew national media attention and caused her trouble, Xinhua news agency reported.<br><br>In the roughly two-minute-long video secretly filmed by one of her students, the psychology professor told her class: "We are in for a difficult time. But again, I do believe that we can get past that. Our nation is divided; we have been assaulted, it's an act of terrorism."<br><br>The video clip prompted outrage and threats to her life. In total, more than 1,000 emails and threatening phone calls were directed at Cox, OCC and her union, local media reported.<br><br>News of threats against the professor came to light as hundreds of people held demonstrations on campus in support of and against her.<br><br>--IANS<br>soni/ahm/dg</p>

item.title: We are ready to discuss Agusta Westland deal: Kharge
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Thursday said his party was ready to discuss the Agusta Westland VVIP chopper deal provided rules were followed.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Thursday said his party was ready to discuss the Agusta Westland VVIP chopper deal provided rules were followed.<p><br><br>"Agusta Westland was discussed at length in the last session. But if they want to discuss it again, we are ready. They should follow certain rules and bring it on the agenda," said Kharge.<br><br>He was speaking to the media in Parliament premises.<br><br>He also accused the government of taking up the issue to divert people's attention from the demonetisation issue.<br><br>"They are raising Agusta Westland issue, they are displaying posters in the house. Their intention is to divert," he said.<br><br>"They are not ready to listen to us. We had also spoken to the Speaker on this."<br><br>Kharge added: "They are creating ruckus. They are not allowing Rahul Gandhi to speak. The floor leaders of the opposition parties wanted to talk. They are also being stopped by the government's brute majority.<br><br>"Today again adjournments happened after every five minutes. The government is running away from discussions. They want the winter session to get over without discussion," he added.<br><br>--IANS<br>sid/in/mr</p>

item.title: Change in timing for Change of Guards ceremony
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Rashtrapati Bhavan on Thursday said the timing of the 'Change of Guard' ceremony to be held on Saturday has been changed.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Rashtrapati Bhavan on Thursday said the timing of the 'Change of Guard' ceremony to be held on Saturday has been changed.<p><br><br>"The Change of Guard Ceremony at Rashtrapati Bhavan will be held at 11.30 a.m. instead of its regular timing 10.00 a.m. this Saturday (December 17, 2016) due to the ceremonial reception being accorded to the President of Tajikistan," the President House said in a release here.<br><br>President of Tajikistan Emomali Rahmon is on a state visit to India from December 14-18. President Rahmon will arrive in New Delhi on December 16 after visiting Kerala.<br><br>Change of Guard is a military tradition where guards and sentries at palaces, forts and defence establishments change periodically to enable a fresh body of troops take charge.<br><br>The ceremony is held every Saturday and is open to the general public for viewing.<br><br>--IANS<br>rs/vgu/dg</p>

item.title: Add glamour to your winter outfits with embroidery
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Embroidery is a great form of embellishment on any clothing styles. So this winter, experiment with these details on denims, leather jackets, boots and many others and lift up the look of your attire, says an expert.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Embroidery is a great form of embellishment on any clothing styles. So this winter, experiment with these details on denims, leather jackets, boots and many others and lift up the look of your attire, says an expert.<p><br><br>Yashodhara Shroff, Director and founder of online shopping store Styletag, shares five ways to incorporate embroidery into your wardrobe. <br><br>* On denim: Colourful embroidery on denim jackets, pants and bags stands out with great vigour and never fails to impress. If you're looking to experiment and love a pop of colour anytime of the day, these are perfect for you. Classroom doodle embroidery is great on western styles and floral on Indian styles.<br><br> * On leather: One could take their pick from an A- line leather skirt, a leather jacket, bags or pants. If you're looking for subtle detailing or a full-on embroidered piece, switching to embroidered leather in the form of a jacket or a practical shopping bag is a wise move to make.<br><br> * On skirts: Nothing makes a statement like a perfect A-line embroidered skirt. Subtle and appealing embroidery on skirts is a class act as opposed to anything else. One can never go wrong with a detailed embroidered skirt when paired with a crisp white shirt. Splurge on some intricately detailed skirts as they will never go out of style.<br><br> * On shoes: A favourite among street style aficionados, embroidery on shoes makes a perfect statement and gives your attire that oomph it requires. Embroidery on the tongue of the sneakers and decorative patterns on block heels and Indian flats like morjaris and jootis are a combination of shoe culture and ethnicity. <br><br>--IANS<br>nv/bg</p>

item.title: 97% of Indians migrating for marriage are female (Special to IANS)
item.description: "It is not a common practice or desirable culture for a Hindu son in India to get separated from his parents on getting married at the instance of the wife, especially when the son is the only earning member in the family," the Supreme Court (SC) noted in a October 2016 judgement, while granting a divorce to a couple from Karnataka.
item.content: "It is not a common practice or desirable culture for a Hindu son in India to get separated from his parents on getting married at the instance of the wife, especially when the son is the only earning member in the family," the Supreme Court (SC) noted in a October 2016 judgement, while granting a divorce to a couple from Karnataka.<p><br><br><br> "In India, generally people do not subscribe to the western thought, where, upon getting married or attaining majority, the son gets separated from the family. In normal circumstances, a wife is expected to be with the family after the marriage. Normally, without any justifiable strong reason, she would never insist that her husband should get separated from the family and live only with her."<br> <br>That observation is echoed in new Census data, which reveals that 97 per cent of 224 million Indians who migrated after marriage are women.<br> <br>Four of every 10 Indians (453 million) are migrants, according to the Census data. That is more than the combined population of the US, Germany and Canada.<br> <br>Marriage is the most common purpose of migration with 49 per cent of them (224 million) migrating for marriage, followed by moving with households (15 per cent) and work/employment (10 per cent).<br> <br>Women migrate more for education but less for employment<br> <br>Of 46.4 million Indians who migrated for work/employment, 7.4 million (16 per cent) were female. No more than 27 per cent of Indian women are in the labour force, the second-lowest rate of female labour-force participation in South Asia after Pakistan, IndiaSpend reported in April 2016.<br> <br>The labour force, however, doesn't include women who do "unpaid care work", which refers to all unpaid services within a household, including care of people, housework and voluntary community work.<br> <br>It appears that more females migrate for business than for employment. Of 4.3 million Indians migrating for business, 1.1 million (26 per cent) were female; 14 per cent of business establishments in India are run by female entrepreneurs, IndiaSpend reported in May 2016.<br> <br>Females account for 40 per cent of Indians who migrate for education, reflecting a nationwide male dominance: As many as 1,403 females have never attended any educational institution for every 1,000 males who have not, IndiaSpend reported in November 2015.<br><br>78 per cent of rural female migrants move for marriage<br> <br>As many as 228 million females from rural areas are migrants, of which 179 million (78 per cent) migrated for marriage; the figure was 46 per cent for females from urban areas.<br> <br>Women from urban areas, on average, marry more than two years later than their rural counterparts, IndiaSpend reported in May 2015.<br> <br>The median age at marriage among urban women was 18.8 years, according to the National Family Health Survey 2005-06, compared with 16.4 years among rural women. A quarter of all women aged 15 to 49 in urban areas have never been married, compared with 17 per cent of rural women.<br> <br>(In arrangement with IndiaSpend.org, a data-driven, non-profit, public interest journalism platform. Devanik Saha is an MA Gender and Development student at Institute of Development Studies, University of Sussex. The views expressed are those of IndiaSpend. Feedback at respond@indiaspend.org) <br><br><br>--IANS/IndiaSpend<br>devanik/vm</p>

item.title: Keeping people off web unacceptable challenge to free speech
item.description: Kolkata, Dec 15 (IANS) Keeping people off the web would create "unacceptable" challenges to freedom of speech and commerce, a US diplomat said here on Thursday, underlining the need for every country to develop a culture of cyber security.
item.content: Kolkata, Dec 15 (IANS) Keeping people off the web would create "unacceptable" challenges to freedom of speech and commerce, a US diplomat said here on Thursday, underlining the need for every country to develop a culture of cyber security.<p><br><br>"In Bangladesh, when people talk about cyber security they are often talking about how to prevent things from getting onto the web," US Ambassador to Bangladesh Marcia Bernicat said.<br><br>"Keeping people off the web would create, major and, I would argue, unacceptable challenges to freedom of speech and freedom of commerce. We are increasingly relying on e-commerce," Bernicat said.<br><br>"It is incumbent upon every country in the world, and certainly the South Asian nations, to find a way to develop and instil a culture of cyber security that comes down to every individual," Bernicat told the Indo-Asia Connectivity for Shared Prosperity conference here.<br><br>The envoy also clarified that open borders did not necessarily create more insecurity.<br><br>"We have seen even terrorists have learned to outsource their activities and they are doing it through internet. So, open borders don't create more insecurity. <br><br>"If you have good anti-money-laundering laws and regulatory regime, then, we sovereign nations, working together can stop all forms of transnational crime but the most challenging in this day and age is cyber security," the diplomat said.<br><br>Adding to the discourse, US Ambassador to Nepal Alaina B. Teplitz said it was necessary to strike a balance in enabling the good parts of the internet.<br><br>"The fine line and balance to be looking for is how to enable the good parts of the internet and the ability for citizens to communicate, access services and obtain information.... <br><br>"For the media to be able to present information and to engage in dialogue and looking very carefully at the regulatory efforts that are applied to the internet... to the online services or digital services to evaluate for unintended consequences," Teplitz said.<br><br>US Ambassador to India Richard Verma said that, across Asia, it was really hard to have true connectivity in the digital area without adequate cyber security.<br><br>"The threats that we are facing in the cyber domain come from individuals who are maybe trying to steal information for their personal gain, they are coming from criminal networks that are exploiting people, <br><br>"They are coming from states that are looking to steal corporate secrets or steal other state's secrets and we really have to have adequate defences on that," Verma said.<br><br>--IANS<br>sgh/in/dg</p>

item.title: Using public toilets while vacationing? Take precautions
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) With Christmas around the corner, the holiday season has officially arrived for travel lovers. While vacationing, clean and hygienic bathrooms must always be your priority and for this, keep in mind a few basic steps like using Indian seat toilets and using tissues while touching the doorknob, says an expert.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) With Christmas around the corner, the holiday season has officially arrived for travel lovers. While vacationing, clean and hygienic bathrooms must always be your priority and for this, keep in mind a few basic steps like using Indian seat toilets and using tissues while touching the doorknob, says an expert.<p><br><br>KE Ranganathan, President, Sales and Marketing, Roca Bathroom Products Pvt Ltd, shares a few insights about what one should keep in mind while using public toilets.<br><br>* First and foremost, avoid touching the toilet doorknob with bare hands. Door knobs carry germs from multiple sources and may cause infections. Try using a tissue paper for holding the knob from outside as well as inside before heading out or going in.<br><br>* Take care of your personal belongings. Germs touching your hands can be easily washed out but once they transmit to your belongings such as phone, handbags, etc, they might infect you. Avoid placing your handbags on the floors and hang it on the hook behind the doors.<br><br>* Always prefer an Indian seat toilet instead of the western style to avoid any direct contact with the toilet surfaces. In case you can't find one, hover over the seat without skin contact or make sure that you wipe the toilet seat before sitting on it.<br><br>* Flush it, turn around and get out of the toilet. The probability of getting infected with air-borne germs and bacteria while flushing is very high. Always close the lid before you flush, take a small tissue to press the flush button and exit the place quickly.<br><br>* Avoid the use of hand dryer, how ever much it might attract you for a quick dry. The blow dryer giving out hot air has the ability to spread the germs present in the air around. To avoid getting infected even after washing hands thoroughly, use a paper towel to dry them. Carry a small handkerchief while you are on the go. <br><br>* In the end, use a hand sanitiser and you are good to go!<br><br>--IANS<br>nv/bg</p>

item.title: Nothing to hide, nothing to fear in Agusta: Antony
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Former Defence Minister A.K. Antony on Thursday said there were no skeletons in the UPA's closet pertaining to the AgustaWestland helicopter deal.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Former Defence Minister A.K. Antony on Thursday said there were no skeletons in the UPA's closet pertaining to the AgustaWestland helicopter deal.<p><br><br>"We have nothing to hide, nothing to fear, no role in it. We are very clear," Antony said outside Parliament.<br><br>"Many a time in Parliament I have explained everything with documents about the whole thing. It was our government that ordered a CBI inquiry, cancelled the contract, filed a case initially and got the money back."<br><br>Antony accused the Modi government of using the issue as a "diversionary tactic".<br><br>"This government ... whenever they are in trouble they bring the subject as a diversionary tactic," he said.<br><br>The Congress leader said party President Sonia Gandhi had nothing to do with the chopper deal.<br><br>"Soniaji has nothing to do with it. Because this chopper is for the use of President, Vice President and Prime Minister. <br><br>"The procurement was (to take place) because of consistent demand from the Indian Air Force from 1999."<br><br>On the arrest of former Air Chief S.P. Tyagi, Aantony said: "Let them complete the inquiry. Let the truth come out."<br><br>The BJP has been aggressively raising the issue of AgustaWestland in Parliament after the arrest of Tyagi.<br><br>--IANS<br>mak/ahm/mr</p>

item.title: Table toppers Chelsea extend EPL lead
item.description: London, Dec 15 (IANS) Chelsea boosted their lead over the rest of the English Premier League (EPL) with a 1-0 away-win against bottom-placed Sunderland, while Liverpool dominated Middlesbrough 3-0 to claim second place -- six points behind the leaders.
item.content: London, Dec 15 (IANS) Chelsea boosted their lead over the rest of the English Premier League (EPL) with a 1-0 away-win against bottom-placed Sunderland, while Liverpool dominated Middlesbrough 3-0 to claim second place -- six points behind the leaders.<p><br><br>In other matches on Wednesday, Manchester United needed a late goal from Zlatan Ibrahimovic to prevail 2-1 over Crystal Palace. Ibrahimovic also had a part in the first goal, providing an assist to Paul Pogba, reports Efe news agency.<br><br>Manchester United are in sixth place, 13 points behind Chelsea, who tied their own record of 10 consecutive wins, set in 2005-2006. Current United coach Jose Mourinho was in charge of Chelsea at that time.<br><br>Cesc Fabregas, making his return to the starting 11 after a long absence, got the goal for Chelsea, though goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois also played a decisive role for the London club, making a pair of great saves.<br><br>Adam Lallana scored twice for Liverpool against Middlesbrough to bring the Reds to 34 points, the same as Arsenal, but the team from Merseyside enjoys a goal advantage over the Gunners, who slip to third place after losing 2-1 to Everton on Tuesday.<br><br>In fourth place are Manchester City, who got goals from Pablo Zabaleta and David Silva on Wednesday to top Watford 2-0 and end a two-match losing streak.<br><br>Tottenham Hotspur maintained their grip on the fifth spot, as Christian Eriksen contributed a brace in a 3-0 home win over Hull City.<br><br>The day's outstanding offensive performance was delivered by Salomon Rondon, who posted a hat trick in West Bromwich Albion's 3-1 victory against Swansea.<br><br>Better known for a stingy defence, West Brom has climbed to seventh place.<br><br>Struggling West Ham United escaped relegation by defeating Burnley 1-0.<br><br>--IANS<br>ajb/dg</p>

item.title: Nida Mahmood steps in as design consultant for Satya Paul labels
item.description: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Club SP and Satya Paul Accessories, labels under the house of brand Satya Paul, on Thursday announced a collaboration with designer Nida Mahmood as the Design Consultant for the Spring Summer 2017 collection.
item.content: New Delhi, Dec 15 (IANS) Club SP and Satya Paul Accessories, labels under the house of brand Satya Paul, on Thursday announced a collaboration with designer Nida Mahmood as the Design Consultant for the Spring Summer 2017 collection.<p><br><br>Known for her distinctive designs and eclectic usage of colours, Nida will provide the design direction for both these brands in the upcoming capsule collection. <br><br>"I would like to speak about the sensibilities of both the brands and how both of them marry perfectly. I believe the creative prowess of the design world combined with the business acumen of the corporate fashion houses can create really impactful partnerships. And I am really positive and excited to start this journey together," the designer said in a statement.<br><br> Launched recently by The House of Satya Paul, Club SP caters to the modern Indian woman who keeps up with the trends without compromising on her comfort.<br><br>"This is the start of an exciting new chapter for us at Genesis Colors with the launch of our new brand Club SP and we are very certain that this capsule collection designed by Nida will help us reach the right audience with some iconic designs in the making." said Nikhil Mehra, CEO, Genesis Group, the company that owns Satya Paul.<br><br>The collection is all set to hit the stores in Feb- March, 2017.<br><br>--IANS<br>nv/bg</p>

item.title: Indian equities trade flat on profit booking, global cues (Lead)
item.description: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Indian equity markets traded on a flat note during the mid-afternoon trade session on Thursday, as negative global indices, coupled with profit booking and a weak rupee, subdued investors' sentiments.
item.content: Mumbai, Dec 15 (IANS) Indian equity markets traded on a flat note during the mid-afternoon trade session on Thursday, as negative global indices, coupled with profit booking and a weak rupee, subdued investors' sentiments.<p><br><br>Besides, the equity markets discounted the much awaited decision of the US Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) to hike interest rates and brushed off their early losses.<br><br>The two benchmark indices, which opened in the red, pared some of their losses, but still traded on a flat note -- marginally in the green, as healthy buying was witnessed in IT, Teck (technology, media and entertainment) and banking stocks.<br><br>The wider 51-scrip Nifty of the National Stock Exchange (NSE) was up a tad by 2.55 points or 0.03 per cent at 8,185 points.<br><br>The barometer 30-scrip Sensitive Index (Sensex) of the BSE, which opened at 26,497.71 points, traded at 26,608.50 points (at 2.30 p.m.) -- inched-up 5.66 points or 0.02 per cent from the previous close at 26,602.84 points.<br><br>The Sensex has so far touched a high of 26,737.86 points and a low of 26,407.58 points during the intra-day trade.<br><br>The BSE market breadth was tilted in favour of the bulls -- with 1,355 advances and 1,145 declines.<br><br>"The much awaited US Federal rate hike was as expected by 25 bps (basis points), signalling more rate hikes in the next year. However, the markets discounted the rate hike and recovered from their earlier losses," Astha Jain, Senior Research Analyst at Hem Securities, told IANS.<br><br>"The global indices were lower following the rate hike as the US dollar index showed a rise. Crude oil prices were also lower."<br><br>According to Dhruv Desai, Director and Chief Operating Officer of Tradebulls, the Nifty faced resistance at higher levels due to profit booking and firm USD/INR futures prices.<br><br>"IT, banking and auto stocks traded with firm sentiments, whereas pharma, oil-gas, textile, aviation and media-entertainment stocks traded with bearish sentiments," Desai elaborated.<br><br>"Cement stocks traded with firm sentiments, whereas FMCG and power stocks traded with mixed sentiments due to profit booking at higher levels."<br><br>On Wednesday, the equity markets were suppressed by upcoming global economic events' risks and weak European indices.<br><br>The barometer index was down 94.98 points or 0.36 per cent, while the NSE Nifty edged down by 39.35 points or 0.48 per cent.<br><br>--IANS<br>ppg-rv/vm</p>

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel to get $15,000 to host Oscars
item.description: Los Angeles, Dec 15 (IANS) Popular chat show host Jimmy Kimmel has revealed that he will be paid $15,000 to anchor the 89th Academy Awards ceremony.
